question: As per which treaty, Marathas lost their pratical independence?
explanation:
As per the Treaty of Bassein (1802), Marathas lost their pratical independence because Baji Rao II accepted nearly all the terms
of the Subsidiary Alliance system. The excerpts of the treaty are
a) British recognized the Peshwa Baji Rao II\'s claim on Poona.
b) Baji Rao II gave up all the rights over Surat and he would not employ any foreigner except British.
c) He would acknowledge the British East India company as the supreme power of India.
d) He agreed to receive regular native infantry with attached European artillerymen on a permanent basis.
e) He would not make war on or peace with any other state without the permission of the British.
f) He would receive a British Resident at his court at Poona.
